When is the best time to go to Chita?

When is the best time to go to Chita? Here's some information to help you in your decision:

The best months for good weather in Chita are June, July and August

On average, the warmest months are June and July

Chita has dry periods in January, February, November and December

The coldest months are January and February

The rainiest months are July and August

Weather and climate in Chita

Chita enjoys a monsoon-influenced subarctic climate in accordance with the Köppen-Geiger classification. The yearly average maximum temperature in Chita is 5°C (ranging from -17°C in january to 27°C in july). Annual rainfall is 485mm, with a minimum of 6mm in january and a maximum of 104mm in july.

Between the months of january and april the climate is very unfavorable. In average, on the morning it is -0°C and you can expect to have 24mm of rainfall/month during this period.

In may the climate is okay. It is for example 16°C as maximum temperature in may and, in may, 3 days of rain are expected.

Between the months of june and august the climate is good. In average, on the morning it is 15°C and you can expect to have 98mm of rainfall/month during this period.

In september the climate is just OK. The record temperature this month is 30°C and it rains in september about 66mm.

From october to december the climate is very unfavorable. At lunchtime, it's -16°C in average and it rains about 9mm each month.
